body_html: @act65 it's not so straightforward because there's no explicit aggregation step. The "aggregation" happens as part of backprop. You need to create custom backprop to get per-example gradients. See thread #4897 for discussion and an example of using khatri-rao product to do this efficiently
body_text: @act65 it's not so straightforward because there's no explicit aggregation step. The "aggregation" happens as part of backprop. You need to create custom backprop to get per-example gradients. See thread #4897 for discussion and an example of using khatri-rao product to do this efficiently
body: @act65 it's not so straightforward because there's no explicit aggregation step. The "aggregation" happens as part of backprop. You need to create custom backprop to get per-example gradients. See thread https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/4897 for discussion and an example of using khatri-rao product to do this efficiently
